page.title: 19OLD SIRS FARM - DAISY HILL
page.content: THERE WAS A{MIXTURE OF ANIMALS}KEPT THERE. THE CROPS WHICH WERE GROWN WERE MAINLY OATS, WHEAT, TURNIPS, MANGLES AND CALE FOR FEEDING TO THE CATTLE IN WINTER. {PEAS}WERE ALSO GROWN AND AN OLD MAP SHOWS OUR GARDEN AS A PEA FIELD. DURING THE 19TH CENTURY THERE WAS ALSO A{SMALL FACTORY WHICH WAS PROBABLY USED FOR SPINNING {SILK, COTTON OR WOOL.} NOWADAYS THE FARM IS FARMED TOGETHER WITH ANOTHER FARM. OTHERWISE IT WOULD NOT MAKE MONEY. THE BARNS AND PIGSTYS ARE LITTLE USED EXCEPT FOR STORAGE OF WOOD AND HAY. THE{GARDEN}SURROUNDING THE HOUSE WAS ONCE A HEN RUN. IT IS NOW VERY LARGE. WE THINK THAT THE PRESENT KITCHEN WAS PROBABLY USED AS A COW SHED. PART OF THE WALLS IN THE HOUSE ARE STILL MADE OF{LATH AND PLASTER (CONTINUED ON P20)
